title: History vs. Cleopatra - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: Who was Cleopatra VII, the last ruler of the Ptolemaic dynasty?

options.label: B
options.text: She was a Macedonian Greek queen who governed Egypt after its conquest by Alexander the Great.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Cleopatra's father incur large debts to the Republic?

options.label: A
options.text: He invested in the Roman economy.

options.label: B
options.text: He sought refuge in Egypt after being defeated by Julius Caesar.

options.label: C
options.text: He was a Roman client state.

options.label: D
options.text: He incurred large debts to the Republic.

multiple-choice.question: What did Julius Caesar demand from Egypt after being defeated in Rome's civil war?

options.label: A
options.text: He demanded the annexation of Egypt.

options.label: B
options.text: He demanded the execution of Cleopatra's brother.

options.label: C
options.text: He demanded the repayment of Egypt's debt.

options.label: D
options.text: He demanded the surrender of Egypt's army.

multiple-choice.question: What was significant about Cleopatra's relationship with Marc Antony?

options.label: C
options.text: It was significant because it led to her involvement in Roman politics.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Cleopatra's story survive mainly in the accounts of her enemies in Rome?

options.label: A
options.text: Because she was a popular figure in Roman history.

options.label: B
options.text: Because she was a powerful woman who ruled Egypt.

options.label: C
options.text: Because later writers filled the gaps with rumors and stereotypes.

options.label: D
options.text: Because her story was well-documented by Roman historians.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Cleopatra's involvement in Roman politics?

options.label: A
options.text: She was able to maintain Egypt's stability and independence.

options.label: B
options.text: She was able to annex Egypt.

options.label: C
options.text: She was able to avoid Roman interference in Egypt's affairs.

options.label: D
options.text: She was able to maintain a good relationship with the Roman Republic.

multiple-choice.question: Who was responsible for the downfall of the Roman Republic?
What was significant about Cleopatra's education?

options.label: A
options.text: She was educated in a city with the world's finest library and scholars.

options.label: B
options.text: She was educated in a Roman school.

options.label: C
options.text: She was educated by her brother.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Cleopatra's policies during her reign?

options.label: C
options.text: Egypt's stability and prosperity were maintained for nearly 22 years.

options.label: D
options.text: Egypt was annexed by the Roman Republic.

multiple-choice.question: Why is Cleopatra's legacy subject to interpretation?

options.label: A
options.text: Because her story was well-documented by Roman historians.

options.label: B
options.text: Because she was a powerful woman who ruled Egypt.

options.label: C
options.text: Because later writers filled the gaps with rumors and stereotypes.

options.label: D
options.text: Because her story was not well-documented.
